name: Poincaré conjecture
rephrased: A finite, simply connected 3D shape with no holes is like a sphere.
implication_form: If a finite, simply connected 3D shape has all loops contractible, then it is a 3-sphere.
explained: The Poincaré conjecture, now proven as a theorem, states that any three-dimensional manifold that is compact, simply connected (meaning every loop can be continuously contracted to a point), and has no holes (i.e., its fundamental group is trivial) is topologically equivalent to the three-dimensional sphere (3-sphere). In simpler terms, it suggests that the only 'bounded' three-dimensional space that is 'sphere-like' (without any handles or holes) is actually a sphere itself.
